name: Second Annual Balmoral Community Art and Garage Sale
description: Huge art and garage sale, with fabulous art available at fabulous prices! See you there!

name: Making Change at Honest Ed's Walking Tour

location.name: Start Point - Honest Ed's former location

description:
Discover a Toronto institution! Explore one of the most vibrant intersections of the city, once the proud home of Honest Ed's. 

We'll explore how Ed Mirvish's bargain store transformed the surrounding neighbourhood, including the nearby Mirvish Village arts community. We'll also explore the important legacy of Blackhurst, a hub for Toronto's Black community. Visit the site of Beverly Mascoll's beauty company, which launched a revolution in Black hair care. We'll also visit the former offices of Contrast newspaper, Canada's oldest newspaper for the Black and Caribbean diaspora.

name: Standup Comedy Special that's Only About Dating
description:
Dan Pan's new stand-up special, Everything Wrong with Dating is a night of unhinged jokes about dating apps, alpha bros, and relationship delusion.

Crowd work at the end, please communicate in advance if you would like to avoid being noticed.

name: Weston Farmers Market
description:
One of the longest running markets of its kind in Toronto, opening annually for 46 years. With its rich and storied history, the market has become a staple event that the Weston community enjoys visiting every year. Generations of families have visited to enjoy some farm fresh produce, dairy, meats, eggs and finely prepared foods, as well as local artisans showcasing their work to the community.

We look forward to welcoming new friends to join us!

name: Obsessions Unraveled

location.name: George Weston Recital Hall, Meridian Arts Centre

description: This exciting season finale explores orchestral narrative and virtuosity. Berlioz's Symphonie Fantastique anchors the program with its vivid emotional arc, while Joel Quarrington brings nuance and flair to Rota's Divertimento Concertante. Coleridge-Taylor's Petite Suite adds lyricism and charm to this compelling close to a season of musical transformation.

name: Downtown Toronto Walk to End ALS
description:
A community-driven fundraising event for those who want to help create a world free this disease.

Whether you attend a local event in your city or town or take part virtually, you will join thousands of others across the country coming together to support people affected by ALS. With more than 20 events happening across Ontario, we look forward to coming together to celebrate and honor the people we have loved and lost to this disease and show support for affected Canadians and their families.

name: HomeExchange Day
description:
For the very first time, we invites thousands of home exchangers across the globe to open their doors or arrange public meet-ups as part of HomeExchange Day â€“ a worldwide celebration of authentic and people-first travel.

More than 3,600 members across over 50 countries are expected to take part in this simultaneous event, including 276 in Canada, opening their homes or welcoming others into their community, and explaining the concept of home swapping to other people who would like to travel differently.

name: Gibraltar Point Summer Arts Market

location.name: Gibraltar Point Centre for the Arts - at the midway point between Centreville theme park and Hanlan's Point Beach

description: Come one, come all! Shop from local artists and craftspeople just steps from the beach.

name: Revisiting Wagner and the Jews: An Enquiry and a Musical Sampling

location.name: Beth Tzedec Congregation - Entrance through rear parking lot off Avenal Dr. and Warwick Ave.

description:
Everyone knows that Wagner was an anti-Semite, Hitler's favourite, and that he was banned in Israel.  Right? Join musicologist Dr. Emilie Hurst and Jewish educator and opera singer Guy Mannheim as they unpack the more complicated story.

Everyone is welcome.

name: Late Night Stand Up
description: Toronto's longest running late-night stand-up show is back. Hosted by Daniel Woodrow of Crave and CBC, featuring 4 headliners. Make this your after dinner plans, bring a date, hit up the group chat, buy drinks, well take care of the rest. On the lineup, featuring Toronto's top comedians, including Sam Norton from Boston Comedy Festival, Rachelle Lauzon from Winnipeg Comedy Fest, Ben Sosa-Wright from CBC's New Wave of Stand-Up, Natasha Lyn Miles from Just For Laughs. Join us!

name: Live Jazz at Beaches Sandbox
description:
Featuring Juno award-nominated saxophonist and composer Alison Young (quartet) and acclaimed multi-instrumentalist Evan Porter (quartet). 

Hosted by the hilarious Ryan Dillon, this intimate concert is part of the pop-up live music and comedy series and will be held on the third floor of Beaches Sandbox, in the heart of Toronto's vibrant Beaches neighbourhood. All proceeds will support providing high-quality, accessible programs for all ages, abilities, and backgrounds.

name: Celebration of the Arts
description: Join us for our 2nd show and sale of the over 25 talented artists of Congregation Darchei Noam, including eight new exhibitors! Art forms include paintings, pottery, textiles, woodworking, photography, glassworks, mixed media and more!

name: Community Environment Day at Old Cummer GO Station
description:
Join Councillor Carroll (Ward 17) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each â€“ cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Cake Decorating - Taylor Swift's "Blank Space" Cake
description:
Join us for an exciting Intro to Masking and Piping class with a twist!

Perfect for beginners, take home a beautifully decorated vanilla cake you made. You will work with a pre-made cake so you can jump right into decorating. One of our expert chefs will guide you step-by-step on American and Swiss buttercream basics, how to fill, stack, crumb coat, and cover a cake, shell and rosette piping with star tips, storage tips, and design skills. All tools and ingredients provided, just bring yourself and have fun!
